result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe L Bohannon Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joe L Bohannon Jr in court.  Attorney Rex R. Anderegg in court for Joe L Bohannon Jr.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement was offered by the State.  Defense seeks to review search warrant to determine whether possible motion is forthcoming.  Court sets this matter for Motion hearing/Projected Guilty Plea. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joe L Bohannon Jr in court.  Attorney Rex R. Anderegg in court for Joe L Bohannon Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense received discovery and an offer from the State. Defense requests additional time to review for possible DPA.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Joe L Bohannon in court with Attorney Rex R. Anderegg.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge VanGrunsven Branch 09.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joe L Bohannon in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defendant appears without counsel.  Court determines that defendant is eligible for counsel to be appointed at COUNTY expense.  Defendant is ordered to re-pay 50% of the attorney fees at the rate of $20.00 per month and is advised that failure to pay will result in the entry of a CIVIL JUDGMENT.  The court will appoint ATTORNEY Rex R. Anderegg to represent the defendant.  Counsel accepts the appointment and is advised of the next court date.  Case scheduled for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.  Signed and Filed.  nk

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joe L Bohannon in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joe L Bohannon in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen as a friend of the court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is allowing Defendant time to hire attorney representation. Case is adjourned back to Out of Custody Court, Safety Building Room 221.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/15/2022 @1p
